page.title: 09Farming
page.content: Agriculture is the main employment of the area. Most of the land is owned by one landowner and many of the farms are tenanted. They vary in size, the average being about 200 acres. The farms combine a mixed form of agriculture with small milking herds, sheep, pigs and arable land. The main crops grown are wheat, barley and oats, some potatoes and oilseed rape and peas are grown on the Home Farm. The River Elwy valley is fertile but a great deal of the land south of the river is on the slopes of Mynydd Gaer which is used for sheep grazing. Most farmers grow fodder to feed their animals in the winter. This is in the form of barley, both grain and straw, hay silage and swedes. Most of the wheat, oilseed rape and peas are sold out of the area.
